title: How to Make Naadan Kadala Curry

steps.headline: Soak the black chickpeas in water for about 10-12 hrs.
steps.description: After the time is up, keep the water to use later.

steps.headline: Rinse the chickpeas, add ½ tbsp of salt to them, then pressure cook them for 15-20 min.
Chop up the onions and tomatoes and slit the green chilies while the chickpeas are in the pressure cooker.
Heat up a frying pan on medium heat, then add the grated coconuts and fry until golden brown.
steps.description: Keep a few coconut chunks aside to use as garnish.

steps.headline: Heat coconut oil in the frying pan, then put the mustard seeds in, cooking them until they begin to sputter.
Add the onions to the pan and saute them until golden brown.
Add the tomatoes and water to the pan, then put on the lid and let cook for 10 minutes.
Remove the lid from the pan after 10 minutes and stir well, creating a soft gravy.
Add the fresh masala to your gravy, then add in 1–2 tablespoon (14.8–29.6 ml) of coconut oil and fry the mix until the ingredients have been fried well and lost their raw flavors.
Add 2 glasses of the chickpea stock water to the gravy mix, then let everything boil for another 10 minutes to allow the flavors to soak in.
Put in the cooked black chickpeas into the gravy and stir well.
Add the green chilies and 4-5 curry leaves, then let the mix boil for 5-6 minutes.
Garnish with 4-5 curry leaves and the remaining fried coconut chunks.
Serve this recipe with rice, dosa (a thin pancake made from rice flour), or puttu (steamed rice pancakes).
